review_title: Great Place To Work For Entry Level
pros:
-Very great experience
-Learn laboratory basics
-Friendly people that work in the building
cons: -The building is older and equipment is older and needs repairs frequently

pros: Physicians really care about the patients and it’s amazing to see
cons: Management is terrible in some departments

review_title: Pockets of excellence in a dying institute
pros: Great amout of paid time off. Certain PIs (such as mine) are very supportive. Postdocs/other scientific staff are allowed to apply for grants even if they aren't faculty members. Some interesting research going on.
cons: People are sometimes treated differently depending on their title (looked down upon if they aren't PIs). Salaries are quite low in general. Institute is poorly funded. Some parts of the building are kind of empty/lonely. Not many students/postdocs. Blanket policies are made and exceptions are rare, which is quite frustrating. There has been a mass exodus of postdocs lately, probably due to low salaries/lack of enrichment programs.

review_title: You are better off being unemployed, avoid at all costs!
pros:
Telling horrible PI where to go, & what to do w/ herself when she gets there!
Being paid out my unused PTO, while moving onto a dynamite job elsewhere.
cons:
HIGHLY toxic work environment due to PI of HLA lab in Genetics Dept.. PI failed to correct my name on a published paper despite my asking for submitted manuscript to be corrected in proof stage.
Apparently it was in retaliation for my waking up, getting a real job, & doing real science at a company where co-workers treat each other w/ respect.  Thought you'd screw me over by spelling my name incorrectly on a paper?  So glad I walked out!  BTW - I now make greater than double what you ever will!

review_title: Success is attained here despite the institute, not because of it.
pros: It's in Oakland and near BART.
cons: Not a very engaging research community, very little collaboration between labs.  Support staff range from indifferent to incompetent.  Too many poorly trained volunteers breaking equipment.

review_title: Lacking morale, unnecessary bureaucracy, management does not serve its scientists to their research well.
job_title: Associate Staff Scientist in Oakland, CA
pros: little or no administrative or teaching duties
cons: Soft money institute with very poor institutional support for research

job_title: Staff Research Associate II in Oakland, CA
pros: Motivated and healthy work environment; great support and wonderful staff.
cons: Administrative structure is always in flux, so you have to ask around to figure out who does what.

pros: people are nice and not stressful, competitive , diversity
cons: administration sucks! The order system basiclly is doing nothing but signing the order sheet.

job_title: Staff Research Associate in Oakland, CA
pros: Location, affiliated with excellent hospital, beautiful courtyard
cons: Neighborhood has crime, can feel unsafe at times, but there are security guards

pros: Small labs, less politics. Good start if you want to get experience.

review_title: Lack of career opportunities and personal development
pros: Flexible work hours and good place to make long term friends.
cons: Funding is a major issue. Don't expect a salary raise even if you are one of the best performers.

Not suitable for graduate students
Uncertainty of keeping your employment
